results.title: Dennis the menace
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, John Hughes, Richard Vane and Nick Castle
results.brief_description: Where Dennis goes, mayhem follows and somehow, most of it seems to land in the lap of his long-suffering next-door neighbour, Mr. Wilson. Cast includes Walter Matthau, Christopher Lloyd, Joan Plowright, Lea Thompson and Mason Gamble as Dennis. Based on Hank Ketcham’s cartoon, Dennis the Menace.

results.title: Dennis O'Hoy: Bendigo Born and Bred
results.brief_description: Interview for the MAP project with lifelong Bendigo resident, Dennis O’Hoy, about his family history in the area, and his great love of, and identification with, the place where he lives.

results.title: Dennis Lillee
results.creator_credit: BBC Enterprises and John E. Bodnar
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cricketing legends”.
One of cricket’s greatest bowlers, with his thick moustache and bristling aggression, Dennis Lillee was both brilliant and charismatic. His new ball partnership with Jeff Thomson was, perhaps, the most feared in the modern game. Courageous, controversial, and always determined, Lillee overcame serious injury to complete a very distinguished career. This program includes a contribution from Rod Marsh who caught 95 catches from Lillee’s bowling.

results.title: Denmark: [Paul Henningsen]
results.brief_description: A visual interpretation of the pattern and tempo of life in Denmark. Observes fishermen hauling in the catch; loading and unloading of cargo at the dock; farmers bringing their products to market and lighter side of life - holiday making and fun at the local carnival.

results.title: Denmark
results.brief_description: A geographical film which deals with the commercial life and work of the Danes. It covers farming, shipyards, engineering, timber-working, matchmaking, boxing, and porcelain.

results.title: Denmark
results.brief_description: Denmark yesterday and today. After giving an idea of the appearance of Denmark the film outlines its history, showing burial mounds of the Bronze Age, and the appearance of churches and other buildings at different times. Also includes footage of the industries, sports and social services of Denmark today; views of Copenhagen; and the coronation of King Frederick.

results.title: Denial
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts and Phillip Crawford
results.brief_description: Kane is a 14-year old with a plan. Using his brother as bait, he steals some money off a man with a model train-set. But the plan goes wrong. If Kane is not careful the things that he wants to keep hidden will be let out. This film deals with the issue of sexual abuse through the eyes of a teenage boy who wants to forget. A very real and powerful portrayl of human nature. (Awards: Winner of the Southern Star Award for Best Film, Winner ATOM Awards 1998 Best Tertiary Short Fiction)

results.title: Deng's legacy: China as an economic force
results.creator_credit: New Eagle International, Richard Hall and Alex Gibney
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “China: unleashing the dragon”.
China’s emergence as a global economic force and dramatic changes within Chinese life are due largely to the policies instituted under Deng Xiaoping. This program examines Deng’s career and the continuing impact of his economic policies. The old style of communism, with its policy of isolation from the West and self-sufficiency, is evolving into a socialist market economy. Joint ventures and foreign investment are becoming popular. The program profiles several such projects and also looks at “special economic zones” such as Hainan which have greater autonomy from the central government. Also looks at some of the problems emerging as a result of rapid change and economic growth, such as prostitution, rural poverty, untempered greed and corruption. Narrated by Joan Chen.

results.title: Demonstration in perception
results.creator_credit: United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description: Presents some of the demonstrations in use at Princeton University, USA, for research in perception. Apparatus employed in the demonstrations includes: three chairs; size, brightness apparatus; overlay table; stationary trapezoid; rotation trapezoid; distorted rooms.
